docs.snippet: THE trade and the public will share the eventful nine-day program of the International Photographic Exposition (IPEX), which opens Saturday at the Coliseum and will run through May 9. IPEX will be open to the public on the two week-ends of the show's...
docs.lead_paragraph: THE trade and the public will share the eventful nine-day program of the International Photographic Exposition (IPEX), which opens Saturday at the Coliseum and will run through May 9. IPEX will be open to the public on the two week-ends of the show's run and every weekday evening except Monday, May 3.

headline.main: IPEX Opens Saturday at the Coliseum

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 25 -- The president of the National Council of Government, the Finance Minister, the board of the official Banco de la Republica and the Congress worked most of the weekend to solve the difficult problems set off by the...
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, April 25 -- The president of the National Council of Government, the Finance Minister, the board of the official Banco de la Republica and the Congress worked most of the weekend to solve the difficult problems set off by the bankruptcy of the Banco Transatlantico del Uruguay, which closed its doors last Thursday.
docs.abstract: Govt seeks to solve problems resulting from failure of Banco Transatlantico del Uruguay; bank employes strike, demanding Job protection; apparent irregularities noted

headline.main: URUGUAY STUDIES CLOSING OF BANK; Officials Work on Weekend to Help Solve Problems

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, Friday, April 30 -- The Organization of American States voted this morning to call a special meeting of the foreign ministers of the Americas for tomorrow to consider "the serious situation" in the Dominican Republic.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Friday, April 30 -- The Organization of American States voted this morning to call a special meeting of the foreign ministers of the Americas for tomorrow to consider "the serious situation" in the Dominican Republic.

headline.main: TALKS TOMORROW; Washington Declares Its Right to Protect American Lives O.A.S. MINISTERS CALLED TO MEET

byline.original: By JOHN W. FINNEYSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, April 30 -- President Johnson announced tonight that a cease-fire plan put forward by the Papal Nuncio had been agreed upon in principle in the Dominican Republic, but that fighting was still going on.
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, April 30 -- President Johnson announced tonight that a cease-fire plan put forward by the Papal Nuncio had been agreed upon in principle in the Dominican Republic, but that fighting was still going on.
docs.abstract: Announces agreement in principle on cease-fire plan in Dominican Repub revolt, TV statement

headline.main: FORMULA REACHED; It Would Assure Safety of All -- Strife Is Still Going On NUNCIO IS SEEKING DOMINICAN PEACE

byline.original: By JOHN W. FINNEYSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 2 -- The Secretary General, U Thant, interrupted his European tour and returned here tonight to participate in tomorrow's meeting of the Security Council on the Dominican crisis.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 2 -- The Secretary General, U Thant, interrupted his European tour and returned here tonight to participate in tomorrow's meeting of the Security Council on the Dominican crisis.
docs.abstract: Thant returns from Eur for Council debate; lauds OAS role but asserts Council responsibility for peace and order; Cuba asks to join debate

headline.main: THANT HALTS TRIP FOR SESSION TODAY; Returns for Council's Debate on Dominican Conflict -- Cuba Asks to Speak THANT HALTS TRIP FOR SESSION TODAY

byline.original: By KATHLEEN McLAUGHLINSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: Uruguay to demand US troops leave
docs.abstract: Uruguay to demand US troops leave

docs.snippet: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 4 -- Uruguay assailed the "Johnson doctrine" today and suggested that the Security Council ask for "an immediate cessation of all unilateral action" in the Dominican Republic.
docs.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS, N.Y., May 4 -- Uruguay assailed the "Johnson doctrine" today and suggested that the Security Council ask for "an immediate cessation of all unilateral action" in the Dominican Republic.

headline.main: URUGUAY ASSAILS NEW U.S. 'DOCTRINE'; Urges U.N. Council to Seek End of Unilateral Action in Dominican Crisis URUGUAY, IN U.N., ASSAILS JOHNSON

byline.original: By THOMAS J. HAMILTONSpecial to The New York Times

docs.snippet: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 5 (Comtelburo) -- About 50 delegates from the nine member countries of the Latin American Free Trade Association continued today discussions on maritime transportation.
docs.lead_paragraph: MONTEVIDEO, Uruguay, May 5 (Comtelburo) -- About 50 delegates from the nine member countries of the Latin American Free Trade Association continued today discussions on maritime transportation.
docs.abstract: Latin Amer Free Trade Assn confs on maritime transportation, Montevideo; coms named to study shipping policy and tech aspects

headline.main: Montevideo Session Weighs Latin-American Ship Policy
